TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ApplicationAccessControlAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies access controls to an assembly containing classes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In .NET Framework version 1.1, if this attribute is not present in the assembly, the COM+ security configuration is enabled by default. This is a change in behavior from .NET Framework version 1.0.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this attribute to control access to an assembly containing <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> classes.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.enterpriseservi_25_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.enterpriseservi_25_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.enterpriseservi_25_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, enabling the COM+ security configuration.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this attribute to control access to an assembly containing <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent> classes.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.enterpriseservi_23_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.enterpriseservi_23_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.enterpriseservi_23_1.vb)]

Docs.param: to allow configuration of security; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and sets the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ApplicationAccessControlAttribute.Value%2A> property indicating whether to enable COM security configuration.
Gets or sets the access checking level to process level or to component level.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is supported only on Windows 2000 and later.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this property.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.enterpriseservi_33_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.enterpriseservi_33_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.enterpriseservi_33_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the remote procedure call (RPC) authentication level.

remarks.format:

[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.enterpriseservi_17_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.enterpriseservi_17_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.enterpriseservi_17_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the impersonation level that is allowed for calling targets of this application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is supported only on Windows 2000 and later.

[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/f57469cf-7d93-405f-ae99-_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/f57469cf-7d93-405f-ae99-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f57469cf-7d93-405f-ae99-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable COM+ security configuration.
Docs.value: if COM+ security configuration is enabled; otherwise, .
